thread.title: Vols offer former Mississippi State commit
thread.title_full: Vols offer former Mississippi State commit

title: Vols offer former Mississippi State commit
text:
Manage Vols offer former Mississippi State commitment A four-star athlete from West Point, Miss., who recently decommitted from Mississippi State picked up an offer from Tennessee on Wednesday. Slot to Tennessee Links (Photo: 247Sports) 
Top247 junior athlete/running back Marcus Murphy of West Point (Miss.) High School, a former Mississippi State commitment, posted on his Twitter account Wednesday afternoon that he received a scholarship offer from Tennessee. 
"Blessed to receive my 6th offer from University of Tennessee," he tweeted. (What's next for the Vols? Make sure you're in the loop ‚Äî take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
The 6-foot-1, 190-pound Murphy, who decommitted from the Bulldogs a little more than a month ago, also holds offers from Michigan, Ole Miss, Louisville and Southern Miss in addition to Mississippi State. He was committed to the Bulldogs for more than seven months before reopening his recruitment. 
Murphy is ranked by 247Sports as the nation's No. 167 overall prospect and No. 10 athlete in the 2018 class. He's also ranked the nation's No. 296 overall player and No. 24 athlete in the industry-generated 247Sports Composite. 
Blessed to receive my 6th offer from University of Tennessee üôåüèæüôèüèæ @DemetricDWarren pic.twitter.com/omakNCi0ai ‚Äî Marcus Murphy (@_2ERA_) February 8, 2017 
All three predictions on the 247Sports Crystal Ball point to Mississippi State as the favorite to land him. BUY ONE MONTH, GET TWO MONTHS FREE to get VIP access to GoVols247. Author
